Fantasy. A staircase in a park, in ruins.

label: Description
value: The staircase leads to a terrace.  A fountain is beside its left top corner. Another fountain is on the substructure of the terrace at right; water flows from a mask in a shell.

value: Black crayon, brush and wash with black ink.

label: Description
value: A scrolling vegetal tripod base supports a straight stem with a baluster detail at center. At top, painted flowers and leaves support a scalloped yellow plate.

label: Description
value: Oval, shaped sides and shaped edge, twisted wire handles. Sides pierced. Black field, decorated in inside of bottom with roses, in pink and green.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1914: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal composition illustrating glower sprays that spring from vertically rising and waved lace bands, to which flower boughs are fastened. One entire repeat is shown with the majority of another at right.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel, pen and brown ink squaring on bluish grey laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A variation of the scheme of 1914-21-47. The sprays start from four boughs which project from the bands. One completely shown, and part of another one.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel, India ink squaring on bluish-grey paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal composition illustrating flowers executed in colored pastel at left, and a small Chinese landscape with bridges and pavilion has been sketched out in white pastel in the center.  To the right are lightly sketched elements in black pastel.  Squared in brown ink.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel, pen and brown ink squaring on bluish grey laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The repeat consists of flower boughs beneath a landscape; a plant, a trellis structure, a thyrsos, a vase containing a plant. A chain consisting of two intertwined waved boughs, connects each motif with its neighbor at right, and with the staggered motif in the row beneath it. One repeat is nearly entirely shown and part of another.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel on gray-blue laid paper, squared with pen and brown ink

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rose boughs grow from a tree trunk

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, brush and gouache on strong paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A tall border is formed by a seesaw motif, intertwined with a ribbon on top and at the bottom. A rinceau is shown over the bottom border. It consists of a waved ribbon with feather motifs; flower boughs are laid upon it. The field shows four horizontal rows with staggered motifs in alternate ones. The first and fourth row consist of flower boughs, the second one of a ships on the sea, framed below by flower boughs, the third one consists of a bunch of flowers. On top are three horizontal rows with flwoer boughs and a repitition of the third row of the border.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A rising border is framed at right by two fold strips around which a ribbon is wound, at left, by the scalloped edge of the field. Two waved flower stems rise in the border. The field shows four dots and two leaves alternating in horizontal and vertical rows.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and blue watercolor, brush and gouache, gold on Dutch paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

label: Physical description
value: Brush and orange, greenish-black gouache on paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Waved and rising stems with naturalistic flowers of different kinds, with leaves and a kind of tentacle.

value: Brush and green, yellow, red, and lilac gouache on dark brown tracing paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Two designs for woven shawls. At left, a design featuring paisley motifs, also referred to as Persian cones. Each cone or teardrop shape is bordered by yellow dotted lines and contains a fantastic plant inside. Dotted outlines of flower boughs in white, yellow, and red appear in the intervals between the paisley motifs. At right, boughs form a kind of escutcheon, where fantastic blossoms rise. Like the paisley motifs on the left, the right blossoms are outlined with yellow dotted lines.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on brown oiled translucent paper mounted on dark brown paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier and Sarah Cooper Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Tracings of Four Flower Boughs for Embroidery

label: Description
